renderers.desc: Holds list of available renderer types that can be created and their aliases, grouped in order of base types (label/point/grid/tri/vector/tracer/line/shape/volume/screen) read only.

renderlist.desc: Sets a list of renderers to create and order they are displayed. This allows overriding the default renderer order, defined by the object order. For valid types see "renderers" property.

subrenderers.desc: List of renderers created for rendering primitives (points, lines, triangles) from more complex renderers (eg: vectors). Allows selection of different primitive rendering modes, globally or per object.

font.desc: Font typeface vector (thicker, better for larger text) or line (better for small labels)

fontscale.desc: Font scaling, applied by multiplying with any existing calculated scaling.

fontsize.desc: Font size, absolute scaling that overrides all automatic calculations of the font size

visible.desc: Set to false to hide object

inview.desc: Set to false to exclude object from bounding box calculation and the default camera view

fixed.desc: Set to true to make all data fixed, not time varying, for this object

renderer.desc: Create a custom renderer using label provided instead of using the default renderers, type of renderer created based on the "geometry" property

shaders.desc: Custom shaders for rendering object, either filenames or source strings, provide either [fragment], [vertex, fragment] or [geometry, vertex, fragment]

uniforms.desc: Custom shader uniforms for rendering objects, list of uniform names, will be copied from property data

steprange.desc: Calculate dynamic range values per step rather than over full time range

cullface.desc: Cull back facing polygons of object surfaces

flat.desc: Renders surfaces as flat shaded, lines/vectors/tracers as 2d, faster but no 3d or lighting

depthtest.desc: Set to false to disable depth test when drawing object so always drawn regardless of 3d position

depthwrite.desc: Set to false to disable depth buffer write when drawing object, so other objects behind it will still be drawn and will appear in front if drawn after this object

dims.desc: Width,Height,Depth override for geometry. Usually this data will be determined from the numpy array shape when loaded from python but setting this property overrides the shape, unless it doesn't match the data size. Note this property is the reverse of the numpy array shape (Depth,Height,Width) or (Height,Width).

shift.desc: Apply a shift to object position by this amount multiplied by model size*10^-7, to fix depth fighting when visualising objects drawn at same depth

colourmap.desc: name of the colourmap to use

opacitymap.desc: name of the opacity colourmap to use

opacity.desc: Opacity of object where 0 is transparent and 1 is opaque

brightness.desc: Brightness of object from -1 (full dark) to 0 (default) to 1 (full light)

contrast.desc: Contrast of object from 0 (none, grey) to 2 (max)

saturation.desc: Saturation of object from 0 (greyscale) to 2 (fully saturated)

shininess.desc: Specular shininess factor, controls size of highlight

light.desc: Light properties, colour Red,Green,Blue values and fourth component if provided is two-sided lighting flag, set to 1.0 to switch to single-sided lighting

lightpos.desc: Light position X Y Z. Default is relative to camera (light moves follows camera, rotating the scene changes the illuminated area). Fourth component, if provided, is scene light flag, set to 1.0 to switch to a position in the scene, regardless of camera/view position the same parts of the scene will be illuminated.

glyphs.desc: Glyph quality 0=none, 1=low, higher=increasing triangulation detail (arrows/shapes etc)

texture.desc: Apply a texture, either external texture image file path to load or colourmap

fliptexture.desc: Flip texture image after loading, usually required

repeat.desc: Repeat texture image enabled, default is clamp to edges

colourby.desc: Index or label of data set to colour object by (requires colour map)

opacityby.desc: Index or label of data set to apply transparency to object by (requires opacity map)

limit.desc: Line length limit, can be used to skip drawing line segments that cross periodic boundary

link.desc: To chain line vertices into longer lines set to true

loop.desc: To join the start and end of linked lines set to true

scalelines.desc: Line scaling multiplier, applies to all line objects

scalepoints.desc: Point scaling multiplier, applies to all points objects

sizeby.desc: Index or label of data set to apply to point sizes

opaque.desc: If opaque flag is set skips depth sorting step and allows individual surface properties to be applied

optimise.desc: Disable this flag to skip the mesh optimisation step

vertexnormals.desc: Disable this flag to skip calculating vertex normals

smoothangle.desc: Angle between surface normals (in degrees) below which normals will be smoothed. Reduce this to preserve hard edges.

flip.desc: Set this flag to reverse the surface faces (currently implemented for grids only)

power.desc: Power used when applying transfer function, 1.0=linear mapping

bloom.desc: Bloom effect, brightens colours, particularly around edges of transparent areas, by using a more additive blend equation. Setting this to ~0.5 will replicate the old (technically incorrect) volume shader blending for lavavu pre v1.5.

samples.desc: Number of samples to take per ray cast, higher = better quality, but slower

isovalue.desc: Isovalue for dynamic isosurface (normalised to [0,1] over actual data range)

isovalues.desc: Isovalues to extract from volume into mesh isosurface

isosmooth.desc: Isosurface smoothing factor for normal calculation

isowalls.desc: Connect isosurface enclosed area with walls

tricubicfilter.desc: Apply a tricubic filter for increased smoothness

densityclip.desc: Density range [min,max] to map, values outside the range are discarded

minclip.desc: (legacy) Minimum density value to map, lower discarded

maxclip.desc: (legacy) Maximum density value to map, higher discarded

scalemax.desc: Length scaling maximum, sets the range over which vectors will be scaled [0,scalemax]. Default automatically calculated based on data max

arrowhead.desc: Arrow head size as a multiple of length or radius, if < 1.0 is multiple of length, if > 1.0 is multiple of radius

scalevectors.desc: Vector scaling multiplier, applies to all vector objects

thickness.desc: Arrow shaft thickness as fixed value (overrides "radius")

length.desc: Arrow fixed length, default is to use vector magnitude

normalise.desc: Normalisation factor to adjust between vector arrows scaled to their vector length or all arrows having a constant length. If 0.0 vectors are scaled to their vector length, if 1.0 vectors are all scaled to the constant "length" property (if property length=0.0, this is ignored).

autoscale.desc: Automatically scale vectors based on maximum magnitude

radius.desc: When applied to Vector Arrows: Arrow shaft radius as ratio of vector length. When applied to shapes: radius of spheres.

steps.desc: Number of time steps to trace particle path

taper.desc: Taper width of tracer arrow up as we get closer to current timestep

fade.desc: Fade opacity of tracer arrow in from transparent as we get closer to current timestep

connect.desc: Set false to render tracers as points instead of connected lines

scaletracers.desc: Tracer scaling multiplier, applies to all tracer objects

scaleshapes.desc: Shape scaling multiplier, applies to all shape objects

widthby.desc: Index or label of data set to apply to shape widths

heightby.desc: Index or label of data set to apply to shape heights

lengthby.desc: Index or label of data set to apply to shape lengths

segments.desc: Triangulation quality for spheres, number of segments to draw (minimum 4)

align.desc: Alignment of colour bar to screen edge, top/bottom/left/right

size.desc: Dimensions of colour bar (length/breadth) in pixels or viewport size ratio

ticks.desc: Number of additional tick marks to draw besides start and end

printticks.desc: Set to false to disable drawing of intermediate tick values

format.desc: Format specifier for label values, eg: %.3[f/e/g] standard, scientific, both

outline.desc: Outline width to draw around colour bar

offset.desc: Margin to parallel edge in pixels or viewport size ratio

position.desc: Margin to perpendicular edge in pixels or viewport size ratio, >0=towards left/bottom, 0=centre (horizontal only), <0=towards right/top

binlabels.desc: Set to true to label discrete bins rather than tick points

logscale.desc: Set to true to use log scales

discrete.desc: Set to true to apply colours as discrete values rather than gradient

interpolate.desc: Set to false to disable interpolation between colours, nearest colour will always be applied

colours.desc: Colour list (or string), X11 colour names, rgb(a) colours or html hex colours

range.desc: Fixed scale range, default is to automatically calculate range based on data min/max

locked.desc: Set to true to lock colourmap ranges to current values

zoomstep.desc: When to apply camera auto-zoom to fit model to window, -1=never, 0=first timestep only, 1=every timestep

margin.desc: Margin in pixels (when >= 1) or ratio of viewport width (when < 1.0) around edges of model when to applying camera auto-zoom

xyzrotate.desc: Camera rotation as Euler angles [x,y,z] - output only

origin.desc: Origin / centre of rotation [x,y,z] if not set, defaults to same as focal point.

near.desc: Near clipping plane position, adjusts where geometry close to the camera is clipped

far.desc: Far clip plane position, adjusts where far geometry is clipped

orthographic.desc: Enable to switch to an orthographic projection instead of the default perspective projection

coordsystem.desc: Set to determine coordinate system, 1=Right-handed (OpenGL default) -1=Left-handed

follow.desc: Enable to follow the model bounding box centre with camera as it changes

title.desc: Title to display at top centre of view

compression.desc: Set zlib compression level for GLDB, -1=default, 0=None, 1=fast, 9=best. LavaVu default is 1 (fast).

ruleraxes.desc: Which figure axes to draw rulers beside (xyzXYZ) lowercase = min, capital = max

rulerticks.desc: Number of tick marks to display on rulers

rulerformat.desc: Format specifier for ruler tick values, eg: %.3[f/e/g] standard, scientific, both

rulerlabels.desc: Tick labels to display on rulers, 2d array, one dimension per model axis, replaces rulerticks. If values are numeric, will define the position value, otherwise define the label only.

fillborder.desc: Draw filled background box around model boundary

axis.desc: Draw X/Y/Z legend showing model axes orientation

axisbox.desc: Custom dimensions of viewport for drawing the axis (x, y, width, height) proportional to main viewport size

quality.desc: Read only: Over-sample antialiasing level, for off-screen rendering

caption.desc: Title for caption area and image output filenames

antialias.desc: Enable multisample anti-aliasing, only works with interactive viewing

fps.desc: Turn on to display FPS count

filestep.desc: Turn on to automatically add and switch to a new timestep after loading a data file

hideall.desc: Turn on to set initial state of all loaded objects to hidden

alpha.desc: Global opacity multiplier where 0 is transparent and 1 is opaque, this is combined with "opacity" prop

noload.desc: Disables initial loading of object data from database, only object names loaded, use the "load" command to subsequently load selected object data

merge.desc: Enable to load subsequent databases into the current model, if disabled then each database is loaded into a new model

trisplit.desc: Imported model triangle subdivision level. Can also be set to 1 to force vertex normals to be recalculated by ignoring any present in the loaded model data.

trilimit.desc: Imported model triangle edge size limit. Triangles will be split until edges below this threashold.

globalcam.desc: Enable global camera for all models (default is separate cam for each)

volres.desc: Volume rendering data voxel resolution X Y Z

volmin.desc: Volume rendering min bound X Y Z

volmax.desc: Volume rendering max bound X Y Z

volsubsample.desc: Volume rendering subsampling factor X Y Z

slicevolumes.desc: Convert full volume data sets to slices (allows cropping and sub-sampling)

slicedump.desc: Export full volume data sets to slices

pointmaxcount.desc: Point render maximum count before auto sub-sampling

pointattribs.desc: Point size/type attributes can be applied per object (requires more GPU ram)

pointattenuate.desc: Point distance size attenuation (points shrink when further from viewer ie: perspective)

pointpixelscale.desc: Set to zero for constant point size in pixels, set to 1 to scale points when the viewport is resized after storing the initial render size. If set to > 1, this is the viewport height where pointsize = pixels. As the viewport height is adjusted points are scaled relative to this height - so points will appear the same regardless of render size

cache.desc: Cache all time varying data in ram on initial load

gpucache.desc: Cache timestep varying data on gpu as well as ram (only if model size permits)

clearstep.desc: Clear all time varying data from previous step on loading another

timestep.desc: Holds the current model timestep, read only, -1 indicates no time varying data loaded

validate.desc: Disable to turn off validation of property names from the dictionary. Allows setting/reading custom properties.

data.desc: Holds a dictionary of data sets in the current model by label, read only
